subject: ODCP Lessons Learned - Response requested
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Goldstein, Marlee (US - Arlington);Ostroff, Adrienne (US - Arlington);Gannaway, Alexis (US - Arlington);Sulva, Matt (US - Arlington);Shallard, Ryan (US - Arlington);Hanks, Benjamin (US - Arlington);Han, Paul (US - Arlington);Cohn, Alison (US - Arlington);Jaeger, Ryan (US - Chicago)
body: To all current and former team members of the ODCP Benefits Correction Project, We are currently winding down the project, which is scheduled to conclude in March.  At ODCP request, we are preparing a presentation of Lessons Learned throughout the benefit correction process, and we would appreciate your feedback. We are looking for any insight you may have into what went well, and what did not, throughout all parts of the benefit correction process, including T01 (recalculation), T03 (initial communication and call center set up), and D01 (due process).  We are NOT looking for any feedback on TO2 and TO4 (quality assurance).  I know some of you have been off the team for quite some time, however any thoughts/ideas/memories/nightmares that you can recall would assist us immensely.   Some general themes to consider would be: 1.       calculation tool enhancements2.       documentation consistency3.       population data reporting4.       plan provision research and application5.       communication clarity6.       feedback collection7.       communication turn-around improvements These are just a few examples; please feel free to comment on these or anything else you can think of. We would like feedback as soon as possible, with a response ideally by Wednesday, the 23rd.  Please let me know if you dont think youll be able to respond by then.  Also, if anyone wants to catch up and discuss in person, my schedule is fairly open this week J.   Thanks to everyone for all the hard work on this engagement.  I did not get the chance to work with all of you, but the effort that went into all phases of this project have been a great help on my first Deloitte staffing! Thanks,Sean Sean BrownleeManager | Human CapitalDeloitte Consulting LLP1919 N. Lynn St, Arlington, VA, 22209Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470sbrownlee@deloitte.com | www.deloitte.com Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index
recipient: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington)
body: From: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 5:52 PMTo: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>Subject: FW: Anti-Bullying Index On Nov 10, 2016, at 9:03 AM, Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> > wrote:	From my perspective, and based on the conversation with Carl, I would suggest focusing on the following FEVS items to construct the Bullying Resilience index. These are proximal measures at  the best of an anti-bullying workplace culture, but the since the FEVS is a standard survey there are not many items that address bullying, workplace violence, coercion, or hostile working environment in any direct way.FEVS ItemsQuestionSurvey Section(36) My organization has prepared employees for potential security threats.My Agency(34) Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).My Agency(37) Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.My Agency(49) My supervisor treats me with respect.My Supervisor(17) I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule or regulation without fear of reprisal.My Work Experience(20) The people I work with cooperate to get the job done.My Work Unit	 	 	From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 8:12 AM	To: Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington); Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington)	Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington); Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington); Knight, Michael (US - Arlington); Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington); Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington)	Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index	 	That would be great. 	Mark  Can you please coordinate with Nkiruka as we move forward? Thank you!	 	Roopa Sanwardeker	Senior Manager	Deloitte Consulting, LLP	Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097	rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 	 	Please consider the environment before printing.	 	From: Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 12:59 AM	To: Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> >	Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com <mailto:raparr@DELOITTE.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com <mailto:kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com> >; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com <mailto:dravindra@deloitte.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com <mailto:vidan@deloitte.com> >; Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington) <kamsmith@deloitte.com <mailto:kamsmith@deloitte.com> >	Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Hi Roopa,	 	This works for us. Please let me know where TO3 members can be most helpful. Would you like us to own the research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.) and assist with slide development?		Regards,	 	Nkiruka 	 	From: Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 9:20 PM	To: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> >	Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com <mailto:raparr@DELOITTE.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com <mailto:kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com> >; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com <mailto:dravindra@deloitte.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com <mailto:vidan@deloitte.com> >; Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington) <kamsmith@deloitte.com <mailto:kamsmith@deloitte.com> >; Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington) <eogbuchiekwe@deloitte.com <mailto:eogbuchiekwe@deloitte.com> >	Subject: Re: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Sounds good Roopa,	I am looping in Kamilah and Nkiruka to make sure TO3 is engaging and supporting the tasks as well. 	 	Thanks,	Maria 		On Nov 9, 2016, at 8:41 PM, Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> > wrote:		Team  Given the tight timeline and the interconnectivity with the TOs, I wanted to confirm the sausage making that will go into creating Carl Bennetts anti-bullying index over the next few days.		 		TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.		 		Tomorrow		        Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)		        Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate		        Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)		 		Friday		        Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID		        Interpret results		        Circulate initial thoughts to leadership		 		Monday		        Incorporate feedback		        Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)		 		Tuesday		        Delivery to client! J 		 		Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done.		 		Thanks!		Roopa		 		Roopa Sanwardeker		Senior Manager		Deloitte Consulting, LLP		Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097		rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 		 		Please consider the environment before printing.		 		From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 		Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM		To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >		Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >		Subject: Anti-Bullying Index		 		Hi Brenda and Cheryl  		 		We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 		 		Background		HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 		 		Data Needed		        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)		        FY16 EEO claims (optional)		        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)		        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)		        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)		 		Suggested Timeline		        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10		        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15		        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16		        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17		 		Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!		 		Thanks,		Roopa		 		Roopa Sanwardeker		Senior Manager		Deloitte Consulting, LLP		Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097		rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 		 		Please consider the environment before printing.

body: Hi David, Please find below a link to SharePoint for your acceptance. Kande, please review beforehand and let us know if you have any changes.  This submission satisfies Delivery Order 01 contractual obligations for Task #5, Deliverable #5a Weekly Project Status Meeting Agenda: Task #5, Deliverable #5a Weekly Project Status Meeting Agenda (November 9, 2016) <http://thegreen.treas.gov/do/dcp/pm/project/post56eligveri/Deliverables/DO1%20-%20Due%20Process%20and%20Debt%20Collection/05a%20-%20Weekly%20Project%20Status%20Meeting%20Agenda/84.%20November%209,%202016/Due%20Process_Weekly%20Project%20Status%20Meeting%20Agenda_2016_11_09.pdf>  As discussed at the last meeting, we will no longer be producing Deliverables #5b Status Report and #6a Template Tracking Log. Please let us know if you have any questions.  Thanks,Sean Sean BrownleeManager | Human CapitalDeloitte Consulting LLP1919 N. Lynn St, Arlington, VA, 22209Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470sbrownlee@deloitte.com | www.deloitte.com Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: FW: ODCP Calculation PDFs
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Goldstein, Marlee (US - Arlington)
body: Sean BrownleeDeloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470 www.deloitte.com From: Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov [mailto:Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov] Sent: Thursday, November 3, 2016 10:03 AMTo: Brownlee, Sean (US - Arlington) <sbrownlee@deloitte.com>Cc: Gilmartin, Michael M (US - Atlanta) <mgilmartin@deloitte.com>; Nancy.Ostrowski@treasury.govSubject: RE: ODCP Calculation PDFs I agree with the tabs to include in the PDFs, and your recommendation about the Notes tab.  From: Brownlee, Sean (US - Arlington) [mailto:sbrownlee@deloitte.com] Sent: Thursday, November 03, 2016 9:58 AMTo: Hooten, KandeCc: Gilmartin, Michael M (US - Atlanta); Ostrowski, NancySubject: [WARNING: MESSAGE ENCRYPTED]ODCP Calculation PDFs Hi Kande, As discussed yesterday, below is a list of the tabs in the Deloitte calculation template, separated between the tabs we think should be included and the ones that we dont believe would be needed in the final PDFs.  I have attached a calculation file and the resulting PDF so you can see what it will look like.   With regards to the Notes tab, our thinking is that different calculation files have different degrees of detail included here.  The various letters that we have drafted have explained the changes in far greater detail and have undergone a great deal more review than what is shown in the calculation file.  Exclusion of this tab may be the safer move, however we welcome your feedback if you disagree.  Let us know if we should discuss this further. Tabs to IncludeInputsPay HistoryService HistorySummary Police/Summary TeachersTO1 Task 5 SummaryTO3 Tabs to ExcludeLongevityCOLAOverpayment HistoryNotesHistorical COLA RatesDropdownGrab payment Data Thanks,Sean Sean BrownleeManager | Human CapitalDeloitte Consulting LLP1919 N. Lynn St, Arlington, VA, 22209Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470sbrownlee@deloitte.com <mailto:sbrownlee@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>  Please consider the environment before printing.   This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. v.E.1

subject: DO1 Deliverable Submission: #5c Meeting Notes (November 2, 2016)
recipient: David.Roth@treasury.gov;Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov;Nancy.Ostrowski@treasury.gov;Iris.Murphy-Jones@treasury.gov
body: Hi David,  Please find below a link to SharePoint for your acceptance. Kande, please review beforehand and let us know if you have any changes.  This submission satisfies Delivery Order 01 contractual obligations for Task #5, Deliverable #5c Meeting Notes: Task #5, Deliverable #5c Meeting Notes (November 2, 2016) <https://thegreen.treas.gov/do/dcp/pm/project/post56eligveri/Deliverables/DO1%20-%20Due%20Process%20and%20Debt%20Collection/05c%20-%20Weekly%20Project%20Status%20Meeting%20Notes/77.%20November%202,%202016/Due%20Process_Weekly%20Project%20Status%20Meeting%20Notes_2016_11_2.pdf>  Please let us know if you have any questions.  Thanks,Marlee Marlee Goldstein Federal Human Capital Analyst | ARADeloitte Consulting LLP 1919 N. Lynn Street, Arlington, VA, 2209-1742 Tel/Direct: +1 703 340 3674 | Fax: +1 844 266 4963 | Mobile: +1 703 615 3527 margoldstein@deloitte.com | www.deloitte.com

subject: Read how Consulting is performing this quarter | well-being spotlight: Jordan Veliz
recipient: Consulting Connect Weekly
body: ConsultingConnectWeekly4 November 2016	 <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/About/Pages/ConsultingPeriodFinancials.aspx> Consultings latest financial snapshot is now available, including year-to-date revenue and EBA. <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/About/Pages/ConsultingPeriodFinancials.aspx>  <https://global.deloitteresources.com/Services/da/us/Pages/Instant-Insight.aspx> Get your regular dose of analytics Vitamin Dalong with what to do, know, and share in the latest Instant Insights. <https://global.deloitteresources.com/Services/da/us/Pages/Instant-Insight.aspx>   <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Pages/USCGO_GlobalConciergeDetectiveAgencyComic.aspx> Securing work authorization for global projects takes time. See what happens when a PMD calls the Global Concierge for advice. <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Pages/USCGO_GlobalConciergeDetectiveAgencyComic.aspx>  <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Career/Documents/SpotlightsInterviewGuide.pdf> Well-being spotlight: Jordan Veliz, Human CapitalIn our latest well-being spotlight, read about Jordan Veliz, <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/News/Publishing/1016/Pages/100416WellBeingJordan.aspx>  a Human Capital manager who is taking a modern approach to well-being by using a meditation app, scheduling walking meetings, and boxing to stay in shape.What constitutes well-being for each of us is as unique as our fingerprints. By sharing our individual strategies, through our new well-being spotlight series, we can learn how others are interpreting, performing, and promoting well-being and put into practice for ourselves. Chances are there are people inspiring well-being near you! Use the new well-being spotlight interview guide <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Career/Documents/SpotlightsInterviewGuide.pdf>  to discover and share well-being stories in your own networks. <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Career/Documents/SpotlightsInterviewGuide.pdf>  <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Pages/ConversationStarters.aspx> What do you think it will take to win in this new environment? Lets discuss here. <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Pages/ConversationStarters.aspx> Official Professional Services Sponsor Professional Services means audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services.*As used in this document, "Deloitte" means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Certain policies, programs, and other benefits referenced in this document may not be applicable to all Deloitte personnel. subject: #ShoutOut to Jonathan Peterson and the Navy Team for driving innovative learning solutions!
recipient: US Federal Human Capital All Practitioners
body: <http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en.html>   Federal Human Capital  |  November 2016#ShoutOut How does an agency as big as the U.S. Navy prepare for a financial audit? They hire Deloitte!  Deloitte brought together the green dot to combine live action video, gamification, and computer-generated imagery into an innovative learning platform that breaks down audit for all the non-CPAs. The project will help clean up the balance sheet for a leaner, meaner Navy.   Kudos to FHCs Jonathan Peterson <mailto:jopeterson@deloitte.com>  for driving innovative learning solutions on this cross-functional win!  Team FHC

subject: eRoom alert: Notice of Benefit Change - James Trainor
recipient: Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov;Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Hi Kande,Below is a link to the benefit adjustment letter for James Trainor.  The calculation file is in the same folder.  Please let us know if you have any questions.Thanks,SeanPlease check out this item in the ODCP Task Order 03 Calculations (P-Z) eRoom:ODCP Task Order 03 Calculations (P-Z)/ Trainor, Jameshttps://er47.deloitteonline.com/eRoom/DTTAME321/ODCPTaskOrder03CalculationsP-Z/0_2d8ffTo turn on notification for this item, go to: https://er47.deloitteonline.com/eRoomASP/FormDispatcher.asp?Dlg=DlgNotifications&ID=0_2d8ff&Ctxt=.DTTAME321.ODCPTaskOrder03CalculationsP-Z.0_2d8ff

subject: FW: Recalculation - Trainor
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Sean BrownleeDeloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470 www.deloitte.com From: Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov [mailto:Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov] Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2016 9:47 AMTo: Brownlee, Sean (US - Arlington) <sbrownlee@deloitte.com>; Ostroff, Adrienne (US - Arlington) <adostroff@deloitte.com>; Gannaway, Alexis (US - Arlington) <agannaway@deloitte.com>; Goldstein, Marlee (US - Arlington) <margoldstein@deloitte.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>Cc: Gilmartin, Michael M (US - Atlanta) <mgilmartin@deloitte.com>Subject: Recalculation - Trainor When I was reviewing James Trainors case for a fault determination, a question arose regarding his prior government service that he purchased.  The original benefit calculation gave him credit for 9 months and 8 days of purchased service; the 3/1/2015 recalculation corrected this to 8 months and 29 days.  However, upon further review, an additional adjustment is needed. His prior government service was with the Executive Protective Service (EPS).  This service should have been credited as departmental service, not as purchased service.  This will result in a net underpayment (error in his average pay resulted in an overpayment) and will eliminate his debt. Heres the background:*         At the time he was appointed to MPD, the plan defined police or fire service to include service with the White House Police force. [Pub. L. 85-157]*         Executive Protective Service was substituted for White House Police force wherever referenced. [Pub. L. 91-297] Please recalculate his benefit assuming the correction is made beginning with the 12/1/2015 benefit payment.  Assume the letter will state that his service with EPS should have been considered departmental service instead of purchased service.  Not sure yet if well include citations to support and, if so, which citations (Im still working through the basis with OGC).  Kande R. HootenOffice of D.C. PensionsOffice: 202.622.0052Mobile: 202.288.6873Kande.hooten@treasury.gov <mailto:Kande.hooten@treasury.gov>

subject: FW: Age-of-Error Standard Call Scripts
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Sean BrownleeDeloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470 www.deloitte.com From: Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov [mailto:Kande.Hooten@treasury.gov] Sent: Wednesday, September 21, 2016 2:35 PMTo: Brownlee, Sean (US - Arlington) <sbrownlee@deloitte.com>Cc: Nancy.Ostrowski@treasury.gov; Gilmartin, Michael M (US - Atlanta) <mgilmartin@deloitte.com>; Gannaway, Alexis (US - Arlington) <agannaway@deloitte.com>Subject: RE: Age-of-Error Standard Call Scripts Looks good  just a few tweaks. You might want to take a look at the notice on the retired firefighters website to see if you need to add to your scripts.  I dont think you will, but you may have a different take. http://www.dcrfa.com/pension-issues.html  From: Brownlee, Sean (US - Arlington) [mailto:sbrownlee@deloitte.com] Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 2:40 PMTo: Hooten, KandeCc: Ostrowski, Nancy; Gilmartin, Michael M (US - Atlanta); Gannaway, Alexis (US - Arlington)Subject: Age-of-Error Standard Call Scripts Hi Kande, Attached are a list of questions we anticipate receiving with regards to the AES communications that are going out.  We used the draft communications you provided as a basis for what callers may know coming in, and what we should or should not share.  Please let us know if you have any changes, or if you would like to discuss. Thanks,Sean Sean BrownleeManager | Human CapitalDeloitte Consulting LLP1919 N. Lynn St, Arlington, VA, 22209Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 1470sbrownlee@deloitte.com <mailto:sbrownlee@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>  Please consider the environment before printing.    This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. v.E.1

subject: RE: Introduction
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Hi Emily  Im actually sitting on 13 today. Come find me outside 13174. Im at the table for 4 against the windows facing Georgetown, underneath the sign that says Human Capital. Thanks!Mark Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com From: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, November 1, 2016 4:44 PMTo: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>Subject: RE: Introduction Sounds good! From: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, November 1, 2016 4:41 PMTo: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Introduction Hi Emily  Im still available. I usually work at 9199. So come find me there tomorrow morning and we can go grab coffee. Thanks!Mark Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>  From: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, November 1, 2016 4:40 PMTo: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >Subject: RE: Introduction Hi Mark, Are you still available to meet with me tomorrow morning to discuss the project? If so, let me know where is most convenient for you, and I will plan to meet you there. Best, Emily From: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, October 25, 2016 11:35 AMTo: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Introduction Hi Emily  I look forward to working with you. If youre in Rosslyn at all this week, put some time on my calendar so we can grab coffee and talk more about the project. I dont have much first-hand experience with good resources for SQL, Ill check with some colleagues. In the meantime, perhaps this Lynda course would be a good place to start: https://www.lynda.com/SQL-tutorials/SQL-Essential-Training/139988-2.html <https://www.lynda.com/SQL-tutorials/SQL-Essential-Training/139988-2.html> . We have free access through Deloitte here: https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/CL/MLD/DLC/FSS/consulting/Pages/Lynda.com.aspx <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/CL/MLD/DLC/FSS/consulting/Pages/Lynda.com.aspx> .  For Python, Id recommend two resources that are both freely available online:1.     Learn Python the Hard Way: https://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/ <https://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/> 2.     Automate the Boring Stuff with Python: https://automatetheboringstuff.com/ <https://automatetheboringstuff.com/>  These are both great introductions to Python and programming in general, but they dont really get into their application in analytics. Ill see if I can find some additional resources along those lines as well. Thanks!Mark   Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>  From: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, October 25, 2016 10:57 AMTo: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >Subject: Introduction Mark, I wanted to introduce you to Emily who will be joining our team at USAID in early November. Emily has a strong stats/modeling background and is looking to build her skillset around other analytics components (i.e. SQL, Python). Can you please suggest any SQL courses or resources you are aware of to get Emily up to speed. Emily  As discussed this morning, Mark is a Sr. Consultant on the project who will be leading the technical work stream.  I wanted to introduce you two as we will all be working closely. Please feel free to connect directly.  Thanks!  Shehzad BashirManager | Human Capital Deloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 882 8378 | Mobile: +1 571 458 0253shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>   Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: If You Haven't Already:  ACTION REQUIRED by Saturday 11:59pm CT
recipient: US National STAFFIT Schedule Reminder (US)
body: <http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en.html>   Deloitte Consulting LLP |  For internal use only  Take Action (if you havent already): Log into STAFFIT to confirm your schedule  As a reminder, all Deloitte professionals are responsible for keeping their schedule current and confirming it in STAFFIT <https://rmss.deloitteresources.com/irj/portal>  each week by Saturday 11:59pm CT. You can also review and confirm your schedule by downloading <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/WT/Tech/Software/Pages/MobileAppsMain.aspx>  the STAFFIT mobile app.  Professionals can modify their schedule throughout the week, but are expected to check the confirmation box in STAFFIT each week between Sunday and Saturday. Each week, please review your schedule for accuracy and completeness by doing the following:        Verify and update all future client service assignments on your STAFFIT schedule        Verify and update all future time allocations* (PTO, training, conferences, etc.) on your STAFFIT schedule       Manually remove assignment hours from the days that also have time allocations and holidays <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/news/publishing/1115/pages/1118152016holidays.aspx>  (Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Impact Day, etc.). STAFFIT does not automatically adjust assignment hours when time allocations* (PTO, training, conferences, etc.) are added.  o   For more information on how to enter time allocations and update client assignments please use the Enter Time Allocations and Update Assignments job-aid <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/PC/PracticeComm/functions/Consulting/Career/Documents/EnterTimeandUpdateAssignments.pdf> o   Please note, only resource managers have the ability to modify historical data in STAFFIT.  If you require edits to historical data, please work with your resource manager. Check STAFFIT Corner <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/pc/practicecomm/functions/consulting/career/pages/staffit.aspx>  for FAQs, job-aids, training, and more information on STAFFIT. For technical assistance, dial 2222 from an office phone or 1-800-DELOITTE.

subject: Redmine Account for USAID
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Parr, Ray (US - Arlington);Carbajales, Henry (US - Arlington);Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington)
body: All,I am attempting to setup what tools and systems we have used in the past. Redmine is a project management tool for development which we have used in the past. This may be more useful during the web development and/or ServiceNow intake tool development to manage tasks, bugs, and features. Please register at the link below. http://10.118.4.223:82/account/register <http://10.118.4.223:82/account/register> After account creation, you should received an email with an activation link. Likely, the activation link will be broken. The fix: If you receive a link like this: http://localhost:3000/account/activate?token=02e3d5f51f602dd016cf1e1891fa20487385da1d <http://localhost:3000/account/activate?token=02e3d5f51f602dd016cf1e1891fa20487385da1d>  just replace localhost:3000 with 10.118.4.223:82 and youre good to go.Let me know if you have questions or run into any other problems. Thanks,Kyle Kyle R. McConnellConsultant | Deloitte ConsultingDeloitte Consulting LLP Mobile: +1 202 7940249kymcconnell@deloitte.com <mailto:kymcconnell@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>  Please consider the environment before printing

subject: RE: What's up?
recipient: McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Parr, Ray (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington);Carbajales, Henry (US - Arlington)
body: Thanks Kyle! [And hi Henry, welcome aboard!] This all sounds excellent. Feel free to keep me in the loop as things progress, new data is received [fingers crossed], or client demands change. Emily  Let me know what kind of regressions you are running. I may start loading and formatting govt-wide FEVS data from prior years, and your work might generate some good ideas about how we should look at the wider data set. Thanks again guys. Dont be shy about letting me know if you need anything. Im always available by text at 703.772.6739. ~Mark   Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com From: McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) Sent: Monday, November 21, 2016 12:31 PMTo: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>; Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>; Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com>; Carbajales, Henry (US - Arlington) <hcarbajales@deloitte.com>Subject: RE: What's up? Hey Mark,Vered: is working on slides for an explanation to the client on how we will be working with our checklist and confirming all the details of what reports need. Additionally, it is to clarify to them that we will need to work together closely to meeting their needs and hopefully exceeding those requirements.Henry: has been spending some time reviewing the project scope and all the documentation. I will likely set him up later with instances of Git repositories so we can walk through the potential web apps we might be developing.Shehzad and Ray: are meeting with the Client to learn more about some of their other FEVS analyses and connect with Elliott. Durga: is editing the SharePoint Intake tool and making sure its functional, pretty enough (but not too much more UX work), and ready for internal use.Emily: is doing some regressions in Excel at the moment. We determined as a group, that we will learn Python, so that we wont have to learn it later and we will be able to verify each others coding scripts and logic. However, at the moment, we decided as our python guru, we will wait for you to walkthrough some of the basic functions of Python as a DML (Data Manipulation Language), rather than sputter and not push forward on the bullying determination.Kyle: Ive spent a fair amount of time setting up Emily and Durga computers with Python and a number of the packages we will likely use. I am going to now link up Henry to Git and after that help Durga with the SharePoint.Thanks,Kyle R. Ill have some time this afternoon, and I can help move some things along on the analytics side. Let me know where youre at so I dont duplicate anyones work. Thanks!Mark Mark L. subject: Automatic reply: Emily Remote
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Thank you for your email. I am out of the office for the Thanksgiving holiday until Monday, 11/28/2016,  and I may have limited access to email during this time.  - If your email relates to USAID, please contact Shehzad Bashir at shebashir@deloitte.com. - If your email relates to Navy BUMED, please contact James Hawkins at jamhawkins@deloitte.com.  - If your matter is urgent, please text me on my personal cell (703.772.6739).  Otherwise, I will respond promptly upon my return on 11/28. Have a happy Thanksgiving!~Mark

subject: RE: USAID Bullying Index - Next Steps
recipient: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington);Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Parr, Ray (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington)
body: Roopa, Thank you for the comprehensive update. A few additional points. I am also including the workplace(TO3 J) team and workplace- specific tasks:        Draft FEVS infographic to be sent out as summary to participating populations. Timeline TBD. (Sarah, please take point on this).        Develop a new slides on The Anatomy of the USAID Bully (Hunter, please take point on this  Carl will be around tomorrow morning, so you and I can briefly connect with him on what he wants to see here) Also, quick clarifications / background:        I understood that they had 80 interested volunteers, but they selected 7 people to drive the CoS        Eileen Simoes and Elliot (didnt get his last name) are leading the FEVS analysis and action planning for USAID (we will likely be working closely with them moving forward).  Have a good night everyone, Maria   From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, November 15, 2016 10:33 PMTo: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com>; Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com>Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com>; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com>; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com>Subject: USAID Bullying Index - Next Steps Team   Below is a high level summary and next steps based on todays meeting. Carl, Maria  please add in if I missed anything. Though FEVS analysis has been done, Brenda, Elliott, and Ilene were happy with the index factors that were explored through our work.  They were in agreement with the factors chosen and thought the analysis results were consistent with their knowledge of the bureaus and departments. The COS (comprised of ~80 volunteers) is meeting on Thursday and Brenda wants Deloitte to support the meeting with our slides and Tableau dashboard. They were also interested in further exploring FEVS analysis and ideas on further socializing the results with stakeholders.  Below is a summary of next steps, owners and associated due dates.        Update Tableau heat map dashboard with FY16 data. Due by tomorrow noon (Shehzad + team).        Create views in Tableau dashboard to show cuts with filters around employee type (FSN, PSC, etc.) based on new dataset from Elliott. Specially, they are looking to know the dimension scores with these filters. The speculation is that FSNs or FSOs may exhibit certain behaviors. Due by tomorrow noon. (Shehzad + team).        Updated timeline slide to include the following next steps. Due tomorrow noon (Shehzad + team).o   Refine question mapping based on COSo   Add business outcome data (claims, attrition, etc.). Interesting side note: Curtailment (leaving a mission early) could be another potential data point. o   Conduct survey as neededo   Conduct qualitative analysis (focus groups)o   Determine anatomy of a bullyo   Conduct social network analysis o   Design recommendations        Determine FEVS infographic to be sent out as summary to participating populations. Timeline TBD. (Maria + TO3 team). Happy to answer any questions or provide more detail. Thanks,Roopa Roopa SanwardekerSenior ManagerDeloitte Consulting, LLPMobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>  Please consider the environment before printing.

recipient: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Parr, Ray (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington)
body: Team   I wanted to thank you and recognize all your hard work in pulling together the materials for todays meeting under such a tight timeframe. Brenda really liked it and was impressed with our work, which was both thoughtful and analytically driven. Looking forward to working on more requests like this with all of you over the next year.  I will send out a summary of meeting notes shortly that summarizes key points and our next steps. body: Hello all,   For our upcoming team meeting we are doing some account team Business Chemistry! For a successful session we need to aggregate everyones results.  In order to aggregate everyone's Business Chemistry results,  we need you to click on the link below and log in. That's it.  The link is right here: https://businesschemistry.deloitte.com/?sessionid=4ed7fa47-0f52-4ca9-8389-9af8ce70b992  (You can also take the test if you have not already).  Once on the page, click the log in button at the top right hand corner and log in (some of you will already be logged in). Then you're good to go! If everyone could do this by Tuesday at 11am  it would be greatly appreciated :).  Thanks!  Paul Paul Hailey Business Analyst | Federal Human Capital Deloitte Consulting LLP 1919 N Lynn St. Arlington, VA 22209 Tel/Direct: 571.814.7788 | Mobile: 202.826.8014phailey@deloitte.com | www.deloitte.com Please consider the environment before printing.-----Original Appointment-----From: Patashnik, Mara (US - Arlington) Sent: Friday, November 11, 2016 2:02 PMTo: Patashnik, Mara (US - Arlington); Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington); Peterson, Jonathan (US - Arlington); Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington); Craig, Tracy (US - Arlington); Johnson, Lisa (US - Arlington); Ju, Patrice (US - Arlington); Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington); Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Hailey, Paul (US - Arlington); Counihan, Ryan (US - Arlington); Dankers, Veronika (US - Arlington); Akoto, Yolanda (US - Arlington); Jenkins, Katarina (US - Arlington); Hopkins, Jon-Matthew (US - Arlington); Sullivan, Kevin Gerard (US - Arlington); Hernandez, Edgar (US - Arlington); Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington); Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington); Javorsky, Katie (US - Arlington); Hammond, Hunter (US - Arlington); Raj, Aparna (US - Arlington); Owolabi, Esther (US - Arlington); Desta, Kidist (US - Arlington); Parker, Camille (US - Arlington); Sabol-Jones, Elizabeth (US - Arlington); Gray, Melissa (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington); Wilson, Sarah (US - Arlington); Kohn, Mike (US - Arlington); Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington); Chau, Andrew (US - Arlington); Worst, Melissa (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Hart, Chelsea (US - Arlington); Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington); Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington)Subject: USAID HRT Team MeetingWhen: Wednesday, November 16, 2016 8:00 AM-11:30 AM (UTC-05:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada).Where: Rosslyn 13828; Tel: +1-615-882-6682,,14532084#; Skype Meeting (connection details below)Hi all,We would like to set aside time for a team-wide meeting now that weve had our client scope discussion. body: Hi Team,  I went ahead and setup a USAID team in iRPM. Id recommend starting with setting up a snapshot request every two months, but Im definitely open to a more/less frequent timeframe if youd like. In addition, please feel free to setup time on my calendar for a one-on-one bi-weekly (or as frequent as you think is appropriate) check-in for feedback. Let me know if you have any questions.  Thanks,Shehzad Shehzad BashirManager | Human Capital Deloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 882 8378 | Mobile: +1 571 458 0253shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>   Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: Tableau License Requests
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington)
body: All, Please find the instructions to download and install your copy of Tableau Desktop Professional from the Deloitte Software catalog. Currently the software catalog maintains download links for versions 8.2, 8.3, 9.0 ,9.2 and 9.3 which you may download depending on the version being used on your current project so please check before downloading.  If you have an earlier version of Tableau currently installed you can choose to either uninstall it after downloading a later version or leaving it installed since the system allows a user to have multiple versions. Best practice however is to uninstall an earlier version if you know if will no longer be needed. If you have an expired or functioning trial version of Tableau loaded you must uninstall and reboot prior to initiating a download from the Deloitte Software catalog. To download your version of Tableau Desktop Professional install from the Deloitte Software Catalog; https://softwarecatalog.deloittenet.deloitte.com/ESD/Packages.aspx <https://softwarecatalog.deloittenet.deloitte.com/ESD/Packages.aspx>   , navigate to the Tableau folder and then download the appropriate version of the software required. Deloittes Tableau license will be embedded in your new Tableau Desktop upon download.  If you have any issues or questions regarding the Tableau Desktop installation, please contact the US Technology Call Center at ustechnologycallcenter@deloitte.com <mailto:ustechnologycallcenter@deloitte.com> .  Please allow a few hours before attempting to download the software since I just added your name to our active directory which takes time to replicate within the system.  Best Regards, Michael R. body: Hi all,We would like to set aside time for a team-wide meeting now that weve had our client scope discussion.  During the meeting, we plan to walk through the full scope of each team, go through PMO logistics, and there will be a few surprises along the way. subject: RE: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs!
recipient: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington)
body: Happy to submit the request for both of you but definitely need to find out if there is cost associated. Can you get any more information.. such as who approves the request? Is there cost associated with it? (If so, who pays for it?) Thanks!  From: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) Sent: Friday, November 11, 2016 11:09 AMTo: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>Cc: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>Subject: FW: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! Hey Shehzad,Do you mind clicking this link: Request a Tableau license <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/HC%20Tableau%20License%20Request%20Form.aspx> ? and recommending us for tableau? Emily and I have already created a request but our Tableau instructors said that if a manager requests the license then they are more likely to get a response.  Thanks,Durga From: Iezzoni, Emma (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 2:53 PMTo: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com <mailto:dravindra@deloitte.com> >Cc: Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) <dommorgan@deloitte.com <mailto:dommorgan@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! Hi Durga,  Thank you for your interest! We will let you know as soon as the Tableau 101 training registration link is live.  In the meantime, you can subscribe to the National Tableau CoP website through their portal here <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/Human%20Capital%20Tableau%20Community%20Portal.aspx>  or by emailing Rachel Oon (US  San Francisco). Please reach out if you have any additional questions. Thank you, Emma Joy Iezzoni | Deloitte.Human CapitalDeloitte Consulting LLP Mobile: +1 571 205 9670 eiezzoni@deloitte.com <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com>  From: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) Sent: Friday, November 4, 2016 8:29 AMTo: Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) <dommorgan@deloitte.com <mailto:dommorgan@deloitte.com> >; Iezzoni, Emma (US - Arlington) <eiezzoni@deloitte.com <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com> >; US National HC Tableau CoP (US) <usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com <mailto:usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! Hi,I am a BTA in the Technology Sector and I was wondering if I could get involved with the HC Tableau COP, subscribe the emails, attend the upcoming Tableau 101 training if possible.  Thanks,Durga From: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) Sent: Friday, November 4, 2016 8:23 AMTo: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com <mailto:dravindra@deloitte.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >Subject: FW: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! FYI  From: Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 3, 2016 10:03 PMTo: Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) <dommorgan@deloitte.com <mailto:dommorgan@deloitte.com> >; Iezzoni, Emma (US - Arlington) <eiezzoni@deloitte.com <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com> >Cc: US National HC Tableau CoP (US) <usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com <mailto:usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! Apologies for the second email. Looks like our voting buttons didnt work on the previous email.  Those of you who have already replied with interest in the live Tableau 101 training, dont worry weve marked your interest. Thanks!Dominic Dominic MorganDeloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 882 5591 | Mobile: +1 202 215 0362 From: Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 3, 2016 9:40 PMTo: Iezzoni, Emma (US - Arlington) <eiezzoni@deloitte.com <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com> >; Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) <dommorgan@deloitte.com <mailto:dommorgan@deloitte.com> >Cc: US National HC Tableau CoP (US) <usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com <mailto:usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com> >Subject: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! Rosslyn Human Capital Community, By way of introduction, Emma Iezzoni <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com>  and I will be serving as the Tableau SMEs for the Rosslyn office this year. As HC Tableau Rosslyn office SMEs, we will be focused on accelerating Tableau engagement across our community by serving as points of contact, helping develop practitioners skills, and also offering advisory support on engagements. First and foremost: The CoP is excited to launch a Tableau 101 course aimed specifically at Human Capital Practitioners. Would you be interested in attending a live Tableau 101 training in this office? Please make sure to use the voting buttons to respond. Click bar at top of message to use voting buttons: We are also looking to this community to help us understand how we can support you better.         Do you need clarification about how the license request process works?        Are there any particular Tableau-related topics or applications you would like to receive training on?         Do you have specific questions on how to do something in Tableau, need deliverable samples, or are looking for a Tableau resource to staff on your project?         Is there something youve looked for and wished you could find on the HC Tableau CoP website <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/Human%20Capital%20Tableau%20Community%20Portal.aspx> ?        If you already use Tableau, are there any challenges holding you back from using Tableau more?  If you have other questions, suggestions, or any comments in general to help us gauge what this HC community needs, Wed love to hear them. Please feel free to reach out to us at any time to talk anything Tableau.  Thanks!Emma Iezzoni and Dominic Morgan

Rosslyn Human Capital Community, By way of introduction, Emma Iezzoni <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com>  and I will be serving as the Tableau SMEs for the Rosslyn office this year. As HC Tableau Rosslyn office SMEs, we will be focused on accelerating Tableau engagement across our community by serving as points of contact, helping develop practitioners skills, and also offering advisory support on engagements. First and foremost: The CoP is excited to launch a Tableau 101 course aimed specifically at Human Capital Practitioners. Would you be interested in attending a live Tableau 101 training in this office? Please make sure to use the voting buttons to respond. Click bar at top of message to use voting buttons: We are also looking to this community to help us understand how we can support you better.         Do you need clarification about how the license request process works?        Are there any particular Tableau-related topics or applications you would like to receive training on?         Do you have specific questions on how to do something in Tableau, need deliverable samples, or are looking for a Tableau resource to staff on your project?         Is there something youve looked for and wished you could find on the HC Tableau CoP website <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/Human%20Capital%20Tableau%20Community%20Portal.aspx> ?        If you already use Tableau, are there any challenges holding you back from using Tableau more?  If you have other questions, suggestions, or any comments in general to help us gauge what this HC community needs, Wed love to hear them. Please feel free to reach out to us at any time to talk anything Tableau.  Thanks!Emma Iezzoni and Dominic Morgan

TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.				 				Tomorrow				       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)				       Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate				       Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)				 				Friday				       Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID				       Interpret results				       Circulate initial thoughts to leadership				 				Monday				       Incorporate feedback				       Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)				 				Tuesday				       Delivery to client! J 				 				Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done.				 				Thanks!				Roopa				 				Roopa Sanwardeker				Senior Manager				Deloitte Consulting, LLP				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 				 				Please consider the environment before printing.				 				From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 				Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM				To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >				Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index				 				Hi Brenda and Cheryl  				 				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 				 				Background				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 				 				Data Needed				       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)				       FY16 EEO claims (optional)				       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)				       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)				       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)				 				Suggested Timeline				       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10				       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15				       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16				       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17				 				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!				 				Thanks,				Roopa				 				Roopa Sanwardeker				Senior Manager				Deloitte Consulting, LLP				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 				 				Please consider the environment before printing.

From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 				Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM				To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >				Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index				 				Hi Brenda and Cheryl  				 				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 				 				Background				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 				 				Data Needed				       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)				       FY16 EEO claims (optional)				       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)				       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)				       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)				 				Suggested Timeline				       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10				       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15				       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16				       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17				 				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!				 				Thanks,				Roopa				 				Roopa Sanwardeker				Senior Manager				Deloitte Consulting, LLP				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 				 				Please consider the environment before printing.

TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.				 				Tomorrow				       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)				       Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate				       Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)				 				Friday				       Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID				       Interpret results				       Circulate initial thoughts to leadership				 				Monday				       Incorporate feedback				       Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)				 				Tuesday				       Delivery to client! J 				 				Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done.				 				Thanks!				Roopa				 				Roopa Sanwardeker				Senior Manager				Deloitte Consulting, LLP				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 				 				Please consider the environment before printing.				 				From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 				Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM				To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >				Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index				 				Hi Brenda and Cheryl  				 				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 				 				Background				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 				 				Data Needed				       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)				       FY16 EEO claims (optional)				       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)				       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)				       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)				 				Suggested Timeline				       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10				       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15				       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16				       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17				 				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!				 				Thanks,				Roopa				 				Roopa Sanwardeker				Senior Manager				Deloitte Consulting, LLP				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 				 				Please consider the environment before printing.

From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 			Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM			To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >			Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >			Subject: Anti-Bullying Index			 			Hi Brenda and Cheryl  			 			We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 			 			Background			HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 			 			Data Needed			       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)			       FY16 EEO claims (optional)			       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)			       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)			       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)			 			Suggested Timeline			       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10			       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15			       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16			       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17			 			Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!			 			Thanks,			Roopa			 			Roopa Sanwardeker			Senior Manager			Deloitte Consulting, LLP			Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097			rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 			 			Please consider the environment before printing.

TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.			 			Tomorrow			       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)			       Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate			       Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)			 			Friday			       Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID			       Interpret results			       Circulate initial thoughts to leadership			 			Monday			       Incorporate feedback			       Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 			Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM			To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >			Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >			Subject: Anti-Bullying Index			 			Hi Brenda and Cheryl  			 			We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 			 			Background			HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 			 			Data Needed			       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)			       FY16 EEO claims (optional)			       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)			       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)			       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)			 			Suggested Timeline			       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10			       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15			       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16			       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17			 			Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!			 			Thanks,			Roopa			 			Roopa Sanwardeker			Senior Manager			Deloitte Consulting, LLP			Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097			rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 			 			Please consider the environment before printing.

From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 				Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM				To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >				Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index				 				Hi Brenda and Cheryl  				 				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 				 				Background				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 				 				Data Needed				       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)				       FY16 EEO claims (optional)				       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)				       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)				       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)				 				Suggested Timeline				       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10				       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15				       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16				       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17				 				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!				 				Thanks,				Roopa				 				Roopa Sanwardeker				Senior Manager				Deloitte Consulting, LLP				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 				 				Please consider the environment before printing.

From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 			Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM			To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >			Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >			Subject: Anti-Bullying Index			 			Hi Brenda and Cheryl  			 			We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 			 			Background			HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 			 			Data Needed			       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)			       FY16 EEO claims (optional)			       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)			       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)			       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)			 			Suggested Timeline			       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10			       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15			       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16			       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17			 			Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!			 			Thanks,			Roopa			 			Roopa Sanwardeker			Senior Manager			Deloitte Consulting, LLP			Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097			rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 			 			Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: FW: Anti-Bullying Index
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: From: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 5:52 PMTo: Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>Subject: FW: Anti-Bullying Index On Nov 10, 2016, at 9:03 AM, Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> > wrote:	From my perspective, and based on the conversation with Carl, I would suggest focusing on the following FEVS items to construct the Bullying Resilience index. These are proximal measures at  the best of an anti-bullying workplace culture, but the since the FEVS is a standard survey there are not many items that address bullying, workplace violence, coercion, or hostile working environment in any direct way.FEVS ItemsQuestionSurvey Section(36) My organization has prepared employees for potential security threats.My Agency(34) Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).My Agency(37) Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.My Agency(49) My supervisor treats me with respect.My Supervisor(17) I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule or regulation without fear of reprisal.My Work Experience(20) The people I work with cooperate to get the job done.My Work Unit	 	 	From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 8:12 AM	To: Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington); Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington)	Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington); Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington); Knight, Michael (US - Arlington); Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington); Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington)	Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index	 	That would be great. 	Mark  Can you please coordinate with Nkiruka as we move forward? Thank you! TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.		 		Tomorrow		        Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)		        Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate		        Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)		 		Friday		        Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID		        Interpret results		        Circulate initial thoughts to leadership		 		Monday		        Incorporate feedback		        Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 		Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM		To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >		Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >		Subject: Anti-Bullying Index		 		Hi Brenda and Cheryl  		 		We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 		 		Background		HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 		 		Data Needed		        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)		        FY16 EEO claims (optional)		        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)		        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)		        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)		 		Suggested Timeline		        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10		        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15		        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16		        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17		 		Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!		 		Thanks,		Roopa		 		Roopa Sanwardeker		Senior Manager		Deloitte Consulting, LLP		Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097		rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 		 		Please consider the environment before printing.
