From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM	To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >	Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Hi Brenda and Cheryl  	 	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 	 	Background	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 	 	Data Needed	       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)	       FY16 EEO claims (optional)	       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)	       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)	       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)	 	Suggested Timeline	       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10	       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15	       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16	       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17	 	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis! Ray, it is mapping pretty well to the SIOP resource you shared. I was not on the Wicked team during the Bullying campaign but have attached their main deck  you may find the stats. in Slide 4 helpful. Please let us know how you end up using. Im not aware of a comprehensive workplace bullying framework, but will let you know if I come across anything else. Best,Colleen From: Hammond, Hunter (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 7:41 AMTo: Brady, Colleen (US - San Francisco) <cobrady@deloitte.com <mailto:cobrady@deloitte.com> >Subject: Fwd: Anti-Bullying Index Hi Colleen, Quick ask for you and the Wicked Problems cohort. I am supporting a new D&I team at USAID and we have a very quick turn around ask to build an anti-bullying index for their office. Do you have access to any research through wicked problems regarding workplace bulling that you could share? In particular, we are hoping to find a framework that addresses bullying in the workplace and what that looks like. Happy to jump on a call today to clarify the ask if needed. We are aiming to pull together a final resource for the client by Tuesday. Who else from your team should we coordinate with?	 	Finally, moving forward, I am only going to cc Mark and Hunter. To everyone else on this email thread, please let me know if you would like to be included for awareness or have any additional insights.	 	Regards,	 	Nkiruka 	 	From: Hammond, Hunter (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 8:30 AM	To: Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington) <eogbuchiekwe@deloitte.com <mailto:eogbuchiekwe@deloitte.com> >	Cc: Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington) <kamsmith@deloitte.com <mailto:kamsmith@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Owolabi, Esther (US - Arlington) <eowolabi@deloitte.com <mailto:eowolabi@deloitte.com> >; Worst, Melissa (US - Arlington) <mworst@deloitte.com <mailto:mworst@deloitte.com> >; Raj, Aparna (US - Arlington) <apraj@deloitte.com <mailto:apraj@deloitte.com> >; Parker, Camille (US - Arlington) <camparker@deloitte.com <mailto:camparker@deloitte.com> >	Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Hi Nkiruka,	 	Thanks for sharing. As mentioned yesterday, Wicked Problems (an internal think tank at Deloitte designed to tackle complex societal problems) had a focus on bullying last year. My disability team works pretty closely with them this year as their focus is on Mental Health now.	 	Colleen Farrell, previously from OTT federal, is a core member of the Wicked Problems team and might have access to research to help with this ask. Below you can find some resources on Wicked Problems and some Anti-Bullying resources they have developed.	         Zoomforth Page: https://deloitte.zoomforth.com/wickedproblems#section/home	         Anti-Bullying Recap: https://deloitte.zoomforth.com/wicked-problems-bullying-prevention#home	         Press Release: https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/news/publishing/1015/pages/102015bullying.aspx	 	Not sure if anyone has reached out to them, but if not, then I am happy to follow-up with them later today. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points.  Data Needed	*       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)	*       FY16 EEO claims (optional)	*       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)	*       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)	*       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional) Suggested Timeline	*       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10	*       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15	*       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16	*       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17 Happy to answer any questions. subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index
recipient: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington)
body: Weve consolidated the FEVS question list agreed upon these bullying-related questions. Note that we marked questions with asterisk if we could not agree on the relevance of a question:15, 17, 20, 22*, 30, 34, 37, 38, 42, 46, 48, 49, 54, 55, 59*  15.   My performance appraisal is a fair reflection of my performance.17.   I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule, or regulation without fear of reprisal20.   ***The people I work with cooperate to get the job done22.   Promotions in my work unit are based on merit.30.   Employees have a feeling of personal empowerment with respect to work processes.34.   Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).37.   Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.38.   Prohibited Personnel Practices (for example, illegally discriminating for or against any employee/applicant, obstructing a person's right to compete for employment, knowingly violating veterans' preference requirements) are not tolerated.42.   My supervisor supports my need to balance work and other life issues.46.   My supervisor provides me with constructive suggestions to improve my job performance48.   My supervisor listens to what I have to say.49.   My supervisor treats me with respect.54.   My organization's senior leaders maintain high standards of honesty and integrity.55.   Supervisors work well with employees of different backgrounds59.   ***Managers support collaboration across work units to accomplish work objectives.  From: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 9:44 AMTo: Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com>Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com>; Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>; Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com>Subject: FW: Anti-Bullying Index Hi Vered, Please start diving into the information below from previous Deloitte research into Bullying. Ill follow up with each of you in person to discuss priorities for today. Thanks!Mark Mark L. body: Hi Mark,Mike and the SRC team can drive the framework. There is a sample D&I dashboard that we might be able to leverage as a guide. If you need dashboard development support Mike can connect you to Emily Anderson from the SRC from Steph's team. From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 		Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM		To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >		Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >		Subject: Anti-Bullying Index		 		Hi Brenda and Cheryl  		 		We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 		 		Background		HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 		 		Data Needed		       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)		       FY16 EEO claims (optional)		       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)		       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)		       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)		 		Suggested Timeline		       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10		       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15		       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16		       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17		 		Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!		 		Thanks,		Roopa		 		Roopa Sanwardeker		Senior Manager		Deloitte Consulting, LLP		Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097		rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 		 		Please consider the environment before printing.

As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 	 	Background	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 	 	Data Needed	       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)	       FY16 EEO claims (optional)	       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)	       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)	       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)	 	Suggested Timeline	       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10	       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15	       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16	       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17	 	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis! body: Thank you everyone.  Im on 13th now, coordinating with the TO2 team and Ill connect with Nkiruka to coordinate with TO3. Can you point me in the direction of some example Inclusion Index products so we can get a better sense of what were ultimately working toward? Is there an interactive Tableau dashboard we can adapt for this purpose as well? Thank you, Kamilah. Ill reach out to Stephanie to see what insights she can share as well. ~Mark Mark L. TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.	 	Tomorrow	       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)	       Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate	       Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)	 	Friday	       Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID	       Interpret results	       Circulate initial thoughts to leadership	 	Monday	       Incorporate feedback	       Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)	 	Tuesday	       Delivery to client! J 	 	Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done.	 	Thanks!	Roopa	 	Roopa Sanwardeker	Senior Manager	Deloitte Consulting, LLP	Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097	rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 	 	Please consider the environment before printing.	 	From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM	To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >	Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Hi Brenda and Cheryl  	 	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 	 	Background	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 	 	Data Needed	       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)	       FY16 EEO claims (optional)	       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)	       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)	       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)	 	Suggested Timeline	       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10	       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15	       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16	       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17	 	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!	 	Thanks,	Roopa	 	Roopa Sanwardeker	Senior Manager	Deloitte Consulting, LLP	Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097	rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 	 	Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: Welcome to the SharePoint group: USAID HCTM Owners for site: USAID HCTM
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Welcome to the 'USAID HCTM Owners' SharePoint group. Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) (i:05.t|adfs|dravindra@deloitte.com) has added you to the 'USAID HCTM Owners' group for this SharePoint site.Group description: Use this group to grant people full control permissions to the SharePoint site: USAID HCTM Welcome to the team As a member of this SharePoint group, you can: * Participate in the SharePoint site at: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM * View the group home page at: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/_layouts/people.aspx?MembershipGroupId=5 What is a SharePoint site?A SharePoint site is a Web site that provides a central storage and collaboration space for documents, information, and ideas. A SharePoint site is a tool for collaboration, just like a telephone is a tool for communication, or a meeting is a tool for decision making. A SharePoint site helps groups of people (whether work teams or social groups) share information and work together. For example, a SharePoint site can help you: * Coordinate projects, calendars, and schedules.* Discuss ideas and review documents or proposals.* Share information and keep in touch with other people.SharePoint sites are dynamic and interactive -- members of the site can contribute their own ideas and content as well as comment on or contribute to other people's.

subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index
recipient: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington);Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington);Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington)
body: From my perspective, and based on the conversation with Carl, I would suggest focusing on the following FEVS items to construct the Bullying Resilience index. These are proximal measures at the best of an anti-bullying workplace culture, but the since the FEVS is a standard survey there are not many items that address bullying, workplace violence, coercion, or hostile working environment in any direct way.FEVS ItemsQuestionSurvey Section(36) My organization has prepared employees for potential security threats.My Agency(34) Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).My Agency(37) Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.My Agency(49) My supervisor treats me with respect.My Supervisor(17) I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule or regulation without fear of reprisal.My Work Experience(20) The people I work with cooperate to get the job done.My Work Unit  From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 10, 2016 8:12 AMTo: Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington); Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington)Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington); Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington); Knight, Michael (US - Arlington); Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington); Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington)Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index That would be great. Mark  Can you please coordinate with Nkiruka as we move forward? Thank you! Roopa SanwardekerSenior ManagerDeloitte Consulting, LLPMobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>  Please consider the environment before printing. Would you like us to own the research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.) and assist with slide development?Regards, Nkiruka  From: Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 9:20 PMTo: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> >Cc: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com <mailto:raparr@DELOITTE.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com <mailto:kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com> >; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com <mailto:dravindra@deloitte.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com <mailto:vidan@deloitte.com> >; Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington) <kamsmith@deloitte.com <mailto:kamsmith@deloitte.com> >; Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington) <eogbuchiekwe@deloitte.com <mailto:eogbuchiekwe@deloitte.com> >Subject: Re: Anti-Bullying Index Sounds good Roopa,I am looping in Kamilah and Nkiruka to make sure TO3 is engaging and supporting the tasks as well.  Thanks,Maria On Nov 9, 2016, at 8:41 PM, Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> > wrote:	Team  Given the tight timeline and the interconnectivity with the TOs, I wanted to confirm the sausage making that will go into creating Carl Bennetts anti-bullying index over the next few days.	 	TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.	 	Tomorrow	        Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)	        Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate	        Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)	 	Friday	        Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID	        Interpret results	        Circulate initial thoughts to leadership	 	Monday	        Incorporate feedback	        Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)	 	Tuesday	        Delivery to client! J 	 	Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done.	 	Thanks!	Roopa	 	Roopa Sanwardeker	Senior Manager	Deloitte Consulting, LLP	Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097	rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 	 	Please consider the environment before printing.	 	From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM	To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >	Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Hi Brenda and Cheryl  	 	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 	 	Background	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 	 	Data Needed	        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)	        FY16 EEO claims (optional)	        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)	        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)	        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)	 	Suggested Timeline	        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10	        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15	        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16	        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17	 	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!	 	Thanks,	Roopa	 	Roopa Sanwardeker	Senior Manager	Deloitte Consulting, LLP	Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097	rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 	 	Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index

body: Hi Roopa, This works for us. Please let me know where TO3 members can be most helpful. From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 	Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 5:30 PM	To: 'cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> ' <cherwilliams@usaid.gov <mailto:cherwilliams@usaid.gov> >; 'bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> ' <bhorne@usaid.gov <mailto:bhorne@usaid.gov> >	Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com <mailto:carbennett@deloitte.com> >; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com <mailto:mdemeke@deloitte.com> >; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com <mailto:kreilly@deloitte.com> >; Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com <mailto:wcarr@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@deloitte.com <mailto:mdonahey@deloitte.com> >	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index	 	Hi Brenda and Cheryl  	 	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 	 	Background	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 	 	Data Needed	        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)	        FY16 EEO claims (optional)	        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)	        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)	        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)	 	Suggested Timeline	        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10	        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15	        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16	        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17	 	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!	 	Thanks,	Roopa	 	Roopa Sanwardeker	Senior Manager	Deloitte Consulting, LLP	Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097	rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 	 	Please consider the environment before printing.

body: Roopa  Carl & I discussed ideas for defining the bullying index and possible approaches for analyzing the available data, which we can apply once we receive the data from USAID. From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) Sent: Wednesday, November 09, 2016 8:42 PMTo: Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington)Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington); Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington); Knight, Michael (US - Arlington); Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington)Subject: FW: Anti-Bullying Index Team  Given the tight timeline and the interconnectivity with the TOs, I wanted to confirm the sausage making that will go into creating Carl Bennetts anti-bullying index over the next few days. TO2s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3. Tomorrow        Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)        Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate        Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.) Friday        Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID        Interpret results        Circulate initial thoughts to leadership Monday        Incorporate feedback        Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?) Tuesday        Delivery to client! J  Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done. subject: Anti-Bullying Index
recipient: cherwilliams@usaid.gov;bhorne@usaid.gov
body: Hi Brenda and Cheryl   We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps.  BackgroundHCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points.  Data Needed        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)        FY16 EEO claims (optional)        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional) Suggested Timeline        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17 Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis! Thanks,Roopa Roopa SanwardekerSenior ManagerDeloitte Consulting, LLPMobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>  Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up
recipient: Knight, Michael (US - Arlington);Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington)
body: Thanks Mike  The concept of a bullying index is a new invention straight from Carls mind, so this would be a custom index. Carl believes that we can adapt the inclusion index for the purpose. If we get ahold of complaint and/or absentee data as well, he believes that might help guide our choices. My team is happy to take the lead on this, but if you have any tools or resources that can be adapted to this effort, we would really appreciate your guidance. If my team were to develop the list of relevant questions, is it possible to generate a cross tabulation for an arbitrary set of questions? Are there any other inputs (such as relative weights of questions) that are also required for the analysis? Thanks again,Mark Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com From: Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 4:52 PMTo: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>; Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>Cc: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>; Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com>; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>Subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up Hi Mark  thanks for the info. I think it would be helpful to know what the specifically the Bullying Index is and how it could be extrapolated from the FEVS data, since there are no items in the standard FEVS questionnaire that actually ask about workplace bullying. Once we know how to construct the bullying index, then it would be a matter of cross tabulating which workgroups/divisions/entities have the greatest prevalence rates for bullying. Depending on the nature of the data we receive from USAID, it may be possible to evaluate the impact of high bullying prevalence rates on other HR outcomes (absenteeism, etc.) The first task is to operationalize the bullying index. Did you have any insights from the meeting on what  was meant by the concept?Thanks From: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) Sent: Wednesday, November 09, 2016 4:08 PMTo: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington)Cc: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington); Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Knight, Michael (US - Arlington)Subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up Thanks Roopa. Hi Mike  Please let me know if there is anything we can assist with the review of the USAID FEVS data. Roopa may have mentioned this already, but our client has additional FEVS data related to their Foreign Service National (FSN) workforce that we may not have access to. They hope to have that to us sometime tomorrow. ~Mark   Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>  From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) Sent: Wednesday, November 9, 2016 3:33 PMTo: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >Cc: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com> >; Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com <mailto:raparr@DELOITTE.com> >; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com <mailto:vidan@deloitte.com> >; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com <mailto:dravindra@deloitte.com> >; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com <mailto:kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >; Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up Thanks Mark.I have the inclusion index, will dig up. subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up
recipient: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington)
body: Hi Mark  thanks for the info. I think it would be helpful to know what the specifically the Bullying Index is and how it could be extrapolated from the FEVS data, since there are no items in the standard FEVS questionnaire that actually ask about workplace bullying. Once we know how to construct the bullying index, then it would be a matter of cross tabulating which workgroups/divisions/entities have the greatest prevalence rates for bullying. Depending on the nature of the data we receive from USAID, it may be possible to evaluate the impact of high bullying prevalence rates on other HR outcomes (absenteeism, etc.) The first task is to operationalize the bullying index. Did you have any insights from the meeting on what  was meant by the concept?Thanks From: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) Sent: Wednesday, November 09, 2016 4:08 PMTo: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington)Cc: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington); Parr, Ray (US - Arlington); Idan, Vered (US - Arlington); Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington); McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington); Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington); Knight, Michael (US - Arlington)Subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up Thanks Roopa. They hope to have that to us sometime tomorrow. ~Mark   Mark L. body: Hello USAID team, Were compiling an old-school face book (2 words J) to help everyone learn names, faces, and karaoke preferences of the USAID HRT team. Attached is a template followed by an example from Jonathan in case you need inspiration. Please fill out the first slide and return to Katarina Jenkins by Thursday, 11/10 COB. These will be shared with the group at our team kickoff meeting which will be scheduled for early next week  invite to come.  If you arent sure of your assigned TO yet, just leave that one blank. Let me know if you have any other questions! -Carol  Carol VaughanSenior Consultant | Federal Human Capital Organizational Transformation and TalentDeloitte Consulting, LLC 1919 N. body: Hi Everyone,The Tableau 101 Lunch and Learn will be held this Friday, November 11th, from 11:00am  1:00pm in 12196 Rosslyn. Attendees will receive 2 hours of learning credits for the training. Please follow the link and register to receive your credit: link to register <https://dlpdelc.deloitteresources.com/content.aspx?src=delus&vdr=saba&crscode=01353855>  Prior to the Tableau 101 training, we request that you download the following files for more hands on time:1. The US County Health Rankings data found here: https://public.tableau.com/en-us/s/resources *	You can also use this direct link to the file <https://public.tableau.com/s/sites/default/files/media/County_Health_Rankings.csv> If you have any questions or difficulties, feel free to email mgaddis@deloitte.com <mailto:mgaddis@deloitte.com> . subject: USAID HRT PTO Guidance
recipient: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington);Peterson, Jonathan (US - Arlington);Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington);Craig, Tracy (US - Arlington);Johnson, Lisa (US - Arlington);Ju, Patrice (US - Arlington);Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Parr, Ray (US - Arlington);Hailey, Paul (US - Arlington);Counihan, Ryan (US - Arlington);Dankers, Veronika (US - Arlington);Akoto, Yolanda (US - Arlington);Jenkins, Katarina (US - Arlington);Hopkins, Jon-Matthew (US - Arlington);Sullivan, Kevin Gerard (US - Arlington);Hernandez, Edgar (US - Arlington);Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington);Javorsky, Katie (US - Arlington);Hammond, Hunter (US - Arlington);Raj, Aparna (US - Arlington);Owolabi, Esther (US - Arlington);Desta, Kidist (US - Arlington);Parker, Camille (US - Arlington);Sabol-Jones, Elizabeth (US - Arlington);Gray, Melissa (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington);Wilson, Sarah (US - Arlington);Kohn, Mike (US - Arlington);Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington);Chau, Andrew (US - Arlington);Worst, Melissa (US - Arlington);McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Hart, Chelsea (US - Arlington)
body: Hi all, As a follow up to Kates email, I wanted to provide guidance on the process for requesting, logging, and taking PTO.  Weve created two different systems for logging approved PTO, one for the holidays, and another for year-round vacations.  It would be great if you could discuss holiday PTO with your team leads as soon as possible.  We also ask that you coordinate your PTO plans with your respective work-stream teams and be proactive to ensure proper coverage of meetings, deadlines, and deliverables. Process for Requesting, Logging, and Taking PTO: 1.       Please request PTO from TO/Change leads at least 3 weeks in advance2.       TO/Change Lead will approve/reject request3.       If approved, please input PTO into the holiday log or SharePoint calendar, and include a contact number. We also request that you send an Outlook calendar invite to TO/Change work-stream members and mark the PTO as free 4.       Finally, we request that you put together a handover memo of all outstanding tasks before you leave for PTO, and send an email to  team members covering tasks (cc TO lead) at least 24 hours prior to departure.  We request that you provide team members with at least a day to ask questions before you leave, and please make sure to inform TO/Change leads of any potential issues. Logging Holiday PTO:   Weve created a holiday specific PTO tracker on the SharePoint site.  Please only log holiday approved PTO using the link below. Each team has their own tab to enter PTO. TO/Change Leads: Please make sure that we have coverage over the holidays.  I plan to include this information on the team calendars, so we are all of coverage aware in case anything comes up.   Holiday PTO Tracker: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/SitePages/Home.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fsites%2FUSAIDHCTM%2FShared%20Documents%2FPMO%2FHoliday%20PTO%20Tracker&FolderCTID=0x01200065292BC8C818474FB1BCF3727733D2AE&View={60667C0B-1629-46A8-BA6C-0206C3D24949} <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/SitePages/Home.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fsites%2FUSAIDHCTM%2FShared%20Documents%2FPMO%2FHoliday%20PTO%20Tracker&FolderCTID=0x01200065292BC8C818474FB1BCF3727733D2AE&View=%7b60667C0B-1629-46A8-BA6C-0206C3D24949%7d>   Logging Year-Round PTO:  Weve created a team calendar to log PTO on the SharePoint site for year-round vacation schedules.  Please log your non-holiday approved PTO for your respective team.  If you are supporting multiple teams, please only log PTO once on the calendar for the primary team you are supporting.          CM: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/CM%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/CM%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>         PMO: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/PMO%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/PMO%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>         TO1: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO1%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO1%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>         TO2: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO2%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO2%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>         TO3: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO3%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO3%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>   Ive attached additional guidance on PTO, sick leave, and working remotely for you reference.  This slide is included in the onboarding deck in case you need to find it at a later point.  If you have any questions about the PTO process or anything else regarding the PMO, please feel free to reach out.   Many thanks,Mara

recipient: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington);Peterson, Jonathan (US - Arlington);Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington);Craig, Tracy (US - Arlington);Johnson, Lisa (US - Arlington);Ju, Patrice (US - Arlington);Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Parr, Ray (US - Arlington);Hailey, Paul (US - Arlington);Counihan, Ryan (US - Arlington);Dankers, Veronika (US - Arlington);Akoto, Yolanda (US - Arlington);Jenkins, Katarina (US - Arlington);Hopkins, Jon-Matthew (US - Arlington);Sullivan, Kevin Gerard (US - Arlington);Patashnik, Mara (US - Arlington);Hernandez, Edgar (US - Arlington);Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington);Javorsky, Katie (US - Arlington);Hammond, Hunter (US - Arlington);Raj, Aparna (US - Arlington);Owolabi, Esther (US - Arlington);Desta, Kidist (US - Arlington);Parker, Camille (US - Arlington);Sabol-Jones, Elizabeth (US - Arlington);Gray, Melissa (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington);Wilson, Sarah (US - Arlington);Kohn, Mike (US - Arlington);Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington);Chau, Andrew (US - Arlington);Worst, Melissa (US - Arlington);McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Hart, Chelsea (US - Arlington)
body: All, Thank you for your patience during what has been a slower than anticipated start. In my conversations with the client, they are REALLY excited for us to get started and to make a big difference fast. They have been frustrated by having a limited staff and moving slower than they would likeso get ready for a fun, exciting, and impactful ride! Our client counterparts have been traveling quite a bit in order to get the word out about the HR Transformation so they have not been readily available for meetings in the last few weeks. We do have a Scope discussion on the calendar for this Wednesday however, so once we get through that we should be able to mobilize all teams. The client COR has also been delayed in getting us the security form that each person needs to fill out to initiate the background check process  we expect to receive those today and we will coordinate with everyone to get those completed. If you havent been connected to your team already, please reach out to your team lead to get involved as we have a lot of work to get done now. As far as staffing goes, we are fully staffed right now pending client and teaming partner scope discussions  I will let you know if there are any additional openings at the end of this week. We will have a team-wide meeting next week to walk through the full scope of each team, go through PMO logistics, and there will be a few surprises along the way. Prior to that, I realize we are fast approaching the holidays and thus PTO is a topic that folks are concerned about. We have a process for requesting and logging PTO that Mara will send out to everyone very soon, so keep an eye out. For those of you who are not aware, a few of us from the team have been working in the 13th floor lounge for now until we get seating, so please join us. We hope to find out about seating / meeting room space tomorrow, so Ill keep you informed. We are optimistic that well get seating for everyone in Rosslyn. Thanks everyone. I hope you had fantastic weekends. Please let me know if you have questions. Kate

Thanks!Dominic Dominic MorganDeloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 882 5591 | Mobile: +1 202 215 0362 From: Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, November 3, 2016 9:40 PMTo: Iezzoni, Emma (US - Arlington) <eiezzoni@deloitte.com <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com> >; Morgan, Dominic (US - Arlington) <dommorgan@deloitte.com <mailto:dommorgan@deloitte.com> >Cc: US National HC Tableau CoP (US) <usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com <mailto:usnationalhctableaucop@deloitte.com> >Subject: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs! Rosslyn Human Capital Community, By way of introduction, Emma Iezzoni <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com>  and I will be serving as the Tableau SMEs for the Rosslyn office this year. As HC Tableau Rosslyn office SMEs, we will be focused on accelerating Tableau engagement across our community by serving as points of contact, helping develop practitioners skills, and also offering advisory support on engagements. First and foremost: The CoP is excited to launch a Tableau 101 course aimed specifically at Human Capital Practitioners. Would you be interested in attending a live Tableau 101 training in this office? Please make sure to use the voting buttons to respond. Click bar at top of message to use voting buttons: We are also looking to this community to help us understand how we can support you better.         Do you need clarification about how the license request process works?        Are there any particular Tableau-related topics or applications you would like to receive training on?         Do you have specific questions on how to do something in Tableau, need deliverable samples, or are looking for a Tableau resource to staff on your project?         Is there something youve looked for and wished you could find on the HC Tableau CoP website <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/Human%20Capital%20Tableau%20Community%20Portal.aspx> ?        If you already use Tableau, are there any challenges holding you back from using Tableau more?  If you have other questions, suggestions, or any comments in general to help us gauge what this HC community needs, Wed love to hear them. Please feel free to reach out to us at any time to talk anything Tableau.  Thanks!Emma Iezzoni and Dominic Morgan

From: Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) Sent: Friday, November 4, 2016 9:32 AMTo: Peterson, Jonathan (US - Arlington) <jopeterson@deloitte.com>; Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com>; Johnson, Lisa (US - Arlington) <lisajohnson9@deloitte.com>Cc: Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com>Subject: Important article to read re: recruitment and hiring All,  The below article is a must read for your teams. Its relevant to all three TOs. Some important actions coming out of this: 1.      Lisa  we need to follow up with Lamont Neal about the OPM hiring data that is to be sent to agencies on Nov. 14th2.      Lisa  we need to understand the process for getting OPM training on the hiring process so we can advise USAID on this and hopefully use OPM in the short term to train their people3.      All  incorporate this information into your metric tracking decisions It would be great to make USAID a poster-child for success against this presidential objective. As we draft our metrics, please think about how we can measure against the 3 objectives outlined in this article so we can provide USAID with the right data / information to tout their efforts to OPM and the White House. https://fcw.com/articles/2016/11/03/streamline-hiring-memo.aspx Thanks, Kate ReillyFederal HR TransformationDeloitte Consulting, LLCTel/Direct: 571.882.8514| Mobile: 202.256.3780www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>

recipient: Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington);Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington);Peterson, Jonathan (US - Arlington);Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington);Craig, Tracy (US - Arlington);Johnson, Lisa (US - Arlington);Ju, Patrice (US - Arlington);Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington);Hailey, Paul (US - Arlington);Counihan, Ryan (US - Arlington);Dankers, Veronika (US - Arlington);Akoto, Yolanda (US - Arlington);Jenkins, Katarina (US - Arlington);Hopkins, Jon-Matthew (US - Arlington);Sullivan, Kevin Gerard (US - Arlington);Patashnik, Mara (US - Arlington);Hernandez, Edgar (US - Arlington);Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington);Smith, Kamilah (US - Arlington);Javorsky, Katie (US - Arlington);Hammond, Hunter (US - Arlington);Raj, Aparna (US - Arlington);Owolabi, Esther (US - Arlington);Desta, Kidist (US - Arlington);Parker, Camille (US - Arlington);Camacho, Julianne (US - Arlington);Sabol-Jones, Elizabeth (US - Arlington);Gray, Melissa (US - Arlington);Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington);Idan, Vered (US - Arlington);Wilson, Sarah (US - Arlington);Kohn, Mike (US - Arlington);Ogbuchiekwe, Nkiruka (US - Arlington);Chau, Andrew (US - Arlington);Worst, Melissa (US - Arlington);McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington);Willebeek-LeMair, Paul (US - Arlington);Keene, Courtney (US - Arlington);Kemp, Hannah (US - Arlington)
body: USAID Confidential Information Management Plan (CIMP)USAID practitioners,Safeguarding confidential information is a business imperative. As stewards of Deloittes reputation, we can proactively coordinate the implementation of leading practices to protect CI and maintain trust.I have attached the approved CIMP guidance for our account and listed several refresher resources below. Please take some to review the attached document and complete the Commit to Confidentiality <https://dlpdelc.deloitteresources.com/content.aspx?src=delus&vdr=saba&crscode=01075971>  course (send me the certificate if you have). It is the responsibility of each practitioner to understand and abide by the procedures detailed in the CIMP. For our account there are two main requirements for Deloitte staff:     1. Take the Commit to Confidentiality course on Deloitte Learning Center (if you have already completed it please send me the certificate); and =     2.  Adhere to the data access/use/storage/transfer/retention/destruction instructions on the USAID Account CI Handling Guidance (slide 3 of attachment).We appreciate your commitment to protecting Deloitte and our clients data. If you have any questions regarding the safeguards and procedures listed in the CIMP, please let me or the Account Data Manager (Vanessa Ramirez <mailto:vbowne@deloitte.com> ) know.  	Additional Resources 	 	 Deloitte Information Security Policy (APR310) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/310_Information_Security_US.aspx>  	 	Deloitte Laptop Security Policy (APR340) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/340_LaptopSecurity_US.aspx> 	 	Deloitte Personal Digital Assistants Policy (APR 360) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/360_PersonalDigitalAssistants_US.aspx> 	 	Understand applicable Deloitte VPN guidance <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/wt/tech/nc/pages/deloittenetvpn.aspx> 	 	Deloitte Wireless Communication Policy (APR 395) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/395_WirelessCommunications_US.aspx>  		Deloitte Commit to Confidentiality training on DLC:https://dlpdelc.deloitteresources.com/content.aspx?src=delus&vdr=saba&crscode=01075971

subject: RE: Introduction
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: Hi Emily  Im still available. I usually work at 9199. So come find me there tomorrow morning and we can go grab coffee. Thanks!Mark Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com From: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, November 1, 2016 4:40 PMTo: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>Subject: RE: Introduction Hi Mark, Are you still available to meet with me tomorrow morning to discuss the project? If so, let me know where is most convenient for you, and I will plan to meet you there. Best, Emily From: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, October 25, 2016 11:35 AMTo: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com> >; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Introduction Hi Emily  I look forward to working with you. If youre in Rosslyn at all this week, put some time on my calendar so we can grab coffee and talk more about the project. I dont have much first-hand experience with good resources for SQL, Ill check with some colleagues. In the meantime, perhaps this Lynda course would be a good place to start: https://www.lynda.com/SQL-tutorials/SQL-Essential-Training/139988-2.html <https://www.lynda.com/SQL-tutorials/SQL-Essential-Training/139988-2.html> . We have free access through Deloitte here: https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/CL/MLD/DLC/FSS/consulting/Pages/Lynda.com.aspx <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/CL/MLD/DLC/FSS/consulting/Pages/Lynda.com.aspx> .  For Python, Id recommend two resources that are both freely available online:1.     Learn Python the Hard Way: https://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/ <https://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/> 2.     Automate the Boring Stuff with Python: https://automatetheboringstuff.com/ <https://automatetheboringstuff.com/>  These are both great introductions to Python and programming in general, but they dont really get into their application in analytics. Ill see if I can find some additional resources along those lines as well. Thanks!Mark   Mark L. DonaheyDeloitte Consulting, LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>  From: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) Sent: Tuesday, October 25, 2016 10:57 AMTo: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com <mailto:mdonahey@DELOITTE.com> >Subject: Introduction Mark, I wanted to introduce you to Emily who will be joining our team at USAID in early November. Emily has a strong stats/modeling background and is looking to build her skillset around other analytics components (i.e. SQL, Python). Can you please suggest any SQL courses or resources you are aware of to get Emily up to speed. Emily  As discussed this morning, Mark is a Sr. Consultant on the project who will be leading the technical work stream.  I wanted to introduce you two as we will all be working closely. Please feel free to connect directly.  Thanks!  Shehzad BashirManager | Human Capital Deloitte Consulting LLPTel/Direct: +1 571 882 8378 | Mobile: +1 571 458 0253shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>   Please consider the environment before printing.

subject: RE: Transition Schedule
recipient: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: That sounds great. Only other thing I would recommend is reading up on USAID background material (proposal response and current state assessment reports - attached) if you have time.  Thanks,Shehzad From: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) Sent: Monday, October 31, 2016 4:13 PMTo: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>Cc: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>Subject: RE: Transition Schedule Thanks Shehzad! I will continue to work through some of the trainings that Mark and Nathan recommended,  and I have a meeting on the calendar to connect with Mark this week to further discuss opportunities to grow my technical skills so that I am ready to get started. Please let me know if there is anything else that I should be doing to prepare to join the team next week. Best, Emily From: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) Sent: Monday, October 31, 2016 3:58 PMTo: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com> >Cc: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> >Subject: RE: Transition Schedule Hi Emily  that transition plan works fine for us. Also, the PTO shouldnt be an issue. Please add your planned PTO to the team calendar Durga setup.  Thanks for the update! Were looking forward to having you on board.  Shehzad From: Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) Sent: Monday, October 31, 2016 11:20 AMTo: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com <mailto:shebashir@deloitte.com> >; Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com> >Subject: Transition Schedule Hi Shehzad and Roopa, I spoke with my manager again today to try and firm up my starting schedule. He is ok with me starting part time on USAID next week, and proposed that I work at ODCP Monday Nov. 7-Wednesday Nov. 9 and then on USAID Thursday Nov. 10 and Friday Nov. 11. The following week he would like me to work 2 days at ODCP and 3 days at USAID. He mentioned that he would prefer me to be at ODCP Tuesday Nov. 15 and Wednesday Nov. 16 and at USAID Monday, Thursday and Friday of that week; however, he is flexible if there are other days that work better for your schedule.   Also, in our initial meeting I mentioned that I would likely need to take PTO for a family trip around the holidays. I have confirmed the dates for that are December 19-January 6. Please let me know if that does not work for the project schedule. Im really looking forward to getting on board! Best,  Emily Bicks Business Analyst | Federal Human Capital Deloitte Consulting LLP 1919 N Lynn St, Rosslyn, VA, 22209Tel/Direct: +1 703 340 3686 | Fax: +1 866 848 2084 | Mobile: +1 202 603 9071embicks@deloitte.com <mailto:embicks@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>   Please consider the environment before printing.

body: Team,One brief follow up from the Kickoff. USAID had wanted to share with us a video they recently produced about the transformation. Technical difficulties in the meeting kept us from viewing it, but you can access it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sY9NQaSjISQ&feature=youtu.beIts just a few minutes so check it out. It will also introduce those of you who are new to faces of some of the leaders for the transformation at USAID. Jonathan _____________________________________________From: Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) Sent: Thursday, October 27, 2016 10:20 PMTo: Craig, Tracy (US - Arlington) <tcraig@deloitte.com>; Ju, Patrice (US - Arlington) <patriceju@deloitte.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com>Cc: Carr, Wendy (US - Arlington) <wcarr@deloitte.com>; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com>; Peterson, Jonathan (US - Arlington) <jopeterson@deloitte.com>; Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) <rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>; Johnson, Lisa (US - Arlington) <lisajohnson9@deloitte.com>; Desai, Urnav (US - Arlington) <udesai@deloitte.com>; Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com>; Thompson, Kate (US - Arlington) <katethompson@deloitte.com>Subject: USAID - KickoffHi everyone, We had a great kickoff meeting with USAID leadership today. They are very energized, the new CHCO (Kim Lewis) is a big proponent of the HR Transformation (phew!), and they have accomplished quite a bit in the past few months. They were really excited to have us onboard because theyve been working hard to get a lot done and feel restricted by the lack of resourcesso I hope youre all ready to knock their socks off :). They are looking to get a lot done quickly, especially in the next two months. Two major things that I want to make sure everyone understands and adopts  you will continue to hear this in our meetings as these were straight from Bob Leavitts mouth (USAIDs HR Transformation Lead):1.	RESPECT  This is a sensitive time at USAID so please treat everyone (I repeat, EVERYONE) with respect and be empathetic to their situation. The change they are about to endure is not easy and we may very well encounter resistance early  be ready for this and be sure to respect everyone. 2.	ORGANIC  USAIDs vision is to have us help them grow their capability organically, so that in 5 years they can run their own operations, do their own workforce analytics, and manage their own culture. At every turn we should be thinking of ways to help them do this (automation is one way). The USAID PMO has been working hard to communicate the HR Transformation effort and from what they see, the skepticism that was once rampant is starting to wane. There seems to be an understanding that effective change is going to take some time to implement and people are willing to give the transformation team space to get it done (they are optimistic due to the success of the contact center implementation that is going very well). It was emphasized that that window of opportunity is SMALL and wont last long  we will have to capitalize on the momentum the team has created and make meaningful impact early. With regard to any specifics around the TOs, please talk with your TO lead in the next day or two. We didnt get to do a deep dive into any of the objectives and plan to do that with USAID the week of 11/7. In the next week, our primary objective is to complete the management plan (which some of you are working) and complete our project plans by Friday, 11/4. We will be creating an integrated project plan during the week of 11/7 (Mara  heads up :) ). We will also need assistance putting together the Performance Management Plan so stay tuned for that. Thanks all, see you Monday.Kate ReillyFederal HR TransformationDeloitte Consulting, LLCTel/Direct: 571.882.8514| Mobile: 202.256.3780www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>

subject: USAID - Foreign Service Experience
recipient: McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: All, We have three distinguished guests joining us to share with us stories and experiences as children of foreign service officers, PSCs at USAID, and consultants to mission projects. The goal of this meeting is to help everyone understand the life of an employee at USAID and the impact that HR has on the employees, their families and their customers in developing countries. In order to make an impact at USAID, we must understand their culture, environment, and mission. Thanks all, hope you can make it. Kate

subject: USAID - Researching Regulations
recipient: McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington);Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington);Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)
body: All, An expert on policy/regulation research will be joining us for this session to share with you some tips and tricks on how, where, and what to search when researching federal regulations. Anne Toomey previously worked at OMB and CIA and is extremely experienced in policy. She is joining us to share her knowledge with you, so please take advantage of this opportunity!Kate
